name: Auto-Slides
description: Official implementation of Auto-Slides: Automatic Academic Presentation Generation with Multi-Agent Collaboration
readme_summary: Auto-Slides is a system that automatically generates presentation slides from academic research papers. It uses a multi-agent framework and large language models to extract content, plan the presentation, and optimize for pedagogical effectiveness, offering interactive customization and multimodal output.
primary_use_case: Automatic generation of academic presentation slides from research papers.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled architect standing before a blueprint-covered table, magically transforming complex academic papers into beautifully structured presentation slides. The architect uses a special pen that emits beams of light, highlighting key information and arranging it into visually appealing layouts on the slides. Small screens display snippets of research papers and corresponding slide previews. The scene is set in a bright, modern studio with a collaborative atmosphere. Subtle digital elements like glowing data streams and UI icons connect the metaphor to software. The composition is clean and focused with a blue and green color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details.

name: web-file-explorer-icons
description: ðŸ“‚ Soothing pastel icons for GitHub, Gitlab, Gitea, Forgejo and more!
readme_summary: The repository provides Catppuccin-themed icons for file explorers on various web-based platforms like GitHub, GitLab, Gitea, Forgejo, Bitbucket, and Tangled. It is implemented as a browser extension available on Chrome, Firefox, and Edge, enhancing the visual appeal of these platforms with soothing pastel icons.
key_features: Support for multiple platforms (GitHub, GitLab, Gitea, Forgejo, Bitbucket, Tangled)
primary_use_case: Enhancing the visual appearance of web-based file explorers with Catppuccin-themed icons.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly chameleon, representing adaptability, is painting icons with Catppuccin pastel colors onto a digital tree representing a file system. The tree's branches are labeled with logos of GitHub, GitLab, and other supported platforms. The chameleon uses a small digital palette with glowing color swatches. A subtle UI element showing a file explorer with the applied icons floats nearby. The scene is set in a bright, airy digital garden with soft, diffused lighting. The composition is clean and focused, with a pastel color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: OpenTagViewer
description: Track your AirTags and iDevices on Android
readme_summary: OpenTagViewer is an Android application that allows users to track Apple AirTags on their Android devices. It leverages the FindMy.py library to retrieve location data and provides a user interface for viewing current and historical locations of AirTags, a feature not natively available on iOS.
key_features: View current location of AirTags on Android
Track and save historical location data
primary_use_case: Tracking Apple AirTags on Android devices.
cover_image_prompt: A detective in a modern, minimalist apartment, using an Android tablet to track several glowing AirTag icons scattered on a map projected onto the wall. The detective is focused, with a magnifying glass hovering over the tablet screen. Subtle UI elements from the OpenTagViewer app are visible on the tablet. The apartment has a large window overlooking a cityscape at night, with faint digital particles floating in the air, connecting the AirTags to the tablet. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and a cool color scheme.

name: weevely3
readme_summary: Weevely is a weaponized web shell designed for post-exploitation. It allows remote shell access to a target web server by uploading a PHP agent, offering modules for administrative tasks, maintaining access, privilege escalation, and network spreading.
key_features: SQL console pivoting on the target
HTTP/HTTPS proxy to browse through the target
Spawn reverse and direct TCP shells
Bruteforce SQL accounts pivoting on the target
primary_use_case: Post-exploitation of web servers to gain remote shell access and perform various administrative and penetration testing tasks.
cover_image_prompt: A locksmith, representing Weevely, skillfully picking the lock of a server room door, symbolizing gaining unauthorized access. Inside, the server hums with activity, representing the compromised system. The locksmith uses specialized tools, each representing a module, like a stethoscope (audit), a miniature drill (file manipulation), and a tiny antenna (network access). Subtle UI elements on the server show command prompts and data streams. The scene is set in a dimly lit, high-tech data center with glowing server racks. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with detailed textures and a cool color palette.

name: gonzo
description: Gonzo! The Go based TUI log analysis tool
readme_summary: Gonzo is a Go-based terminal UI (TUI) log analysis tool. It provides real-time analysis of log streams from various sources like stdin, files, Kubernetes, and OTLP, offering features like interactive dashboards with charts, advanced filtering, customizable themes, and AI-powered insights.
primary_use_case: Analyzing and visualizing log data in real-time from various sources within a terminal environment.
cover_image_prompt: A detective in a dimly lit, futuristic office, meticulously examining streams of glowing data flowing through a magnifying glass. The data streams represent log files, and the magnifying glass reveals hidden patterns and anomalies. Small screens display real-time charts and graphs derived from the logs. The office is filled with subtle tech elements, like glowing server racks and data visualizations projected onto the walls. The repository name, 'Gonzo,' is subtly displayed on a neon sign. The scene has a noir-inspired aesthetic with blues and purples. The image should be in digital painting style with clean lines and clear details.

name: cagent
description: Agent Builder and Runtime by Docker Engineering
readme_summary: cagent is a multi-agent runtime that allows users to create and run intelligent AI agents with specialized knowledge, tools, and capabilities. It supports MCP servers for accessing external tools and can expose agents as MCP tools for other clients to use.
key_features: Customizable agent behavior with instructions and toolsets
primary_use_case: Orchestrating AI agents with specialized capabilities to solve complex problems.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a conductor leading an orchestra of robots, each robot playing a different instrument representing a specialized AI agent. The conductor, representing cagent, orchestrates the robots to create a harmonious melody, symbolizing the solution to a complex problem. Wires and data streams connect the robots, visualized as glowing musical notes flowing from one robot to another. A large screen behind the orchestra displays a simplified UI showing the agents interacting. The scene is set in a futuristic concert hall with vibrant lighting. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.
